alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Jefferson (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:06PM EST until January 10 at 7:48PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...West Virginia... Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg affecting Spotsylvania, Stafford and City of Fredericksburg independent cities. Opequon Creek near Martinsburg affecting Berkeley and Jefferson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...Maryland...West Virginia... Rappahannock River at Remington affecting Fauquier and Culpeper Counties. Rapidan River Near Culpeper affecting Spotsylvania, Orange and Culpeper Counties. Conococheague Creek at Fairview affecting Washington County. Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River above Fredericksburg affecting Spotsylvania, Stafford and City of Fredericksburg independent cities. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Conococheague Creek...including Fairview...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Monocacy River...including Frederick...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Opequon Creek near Martinsburg. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Floodwaters begin to cover Douglas Grove Road (County Road 9/16) east of Martinsburg. A portion of Bowers Road is also flooded. Low lying areas near the creek begin to flood. Water also begins to cover the stream access point at the Van Metre Ford Pedestrian Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:17 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet, or 0.1 feet above flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:17 PM EST Wednesday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.9 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 04/15/1984. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Thu Thu Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Opequon Creek Martinsburg 10.0 10.1 Wed 1 pm 8.9 6.9 5.5 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EST.
